intro: Odontarrhena condensata, commonly known as the Cape jasmine, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture with a slight pubescence. Odontarrhena condensata is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions.
